page.title: 05Great Maytham Hall,Rolvenden
page.content: {Great Maytham Hall}is one of the largest of the country houses in the area. The manor of "Mayhamme" was mentioned in the Domesday Book but the first house was not built until 1721. It has been re-built several times and the present house was designed by Sir Edwin Lutyens in 1909. The house fell into disrepair between 1936 and 1955 and was almost pulled down but a housing association bought it, restored it and converted it into apartments for retired people. Today 34 people share the luxury which was once for one family. There are almost 100 rooms in the house now and 6 acres of peaceful gardens. The most famous part of the gardens is the walled garden which inspired Francis Hodgson Burnett to write "The Secret Garden" during the time that she rented the house in 1898.
